## Description {#details}

Convert &#91;vectors of&#93; buffer fat pointers to integers when they are read from or stored to memory.

This ensures that these pointers will have the same memory layout as before they are lowered, even though they will no longer have their previous layout in registers/in the program (they&#39;ll be broken down into resource and offset parts). This has the downside of imposing marshalling costs when reading or storing these values, but since placing such pointers into memory is an uncommon operation at best, we feel that this cost is acceptable for better performance in the common case.

Definition at line 434 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpulowerbufferfatpointers-cpp">AMDGPULowerBufferFatPointers.cpp</a>.
